intro: Romulea cruciata var. vulgaris, commonly known as the common romulea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Iridaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences composed of numerous small, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces a basal rosette of foliage. Romulea cruciata var. vulgaris is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
